title: Sohail Khan faces fine for violating PCB’s code of conduct
text:
Sindh’s pacer Sohail Khan has been fined 50 percent of his match fees for violating the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB)’s code of conduct during Quaid-e-Azam Trophy fixture at United Bank Limited (UBL) Sports Complex, Karachi.

Khan was charged for a level 2 offence relating to personal abuse of a player, player support personnel, umpire or match referee.

On the other hand, opener Abid Ali also got a warning for showing dissent to umpire’s decision to call him out.

The on-field umpires Khalid Mahmood and Tahir Rasheed took action while match referee Iftikhar Ahmed imposed the decision. Both the players have accepted the sanction.
